alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Monroe (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 21 at 9:46AM CST until January 30 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Arkansas... White River At Clarendon affecting Arkansas and Monroe Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY, JANUARY 30... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Clarendon. * WHEN...Until Sunday, January 30. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, River flows in many side channels and creates islands between the river and sloughs and creeks. Flooding of cropland and timber is occurring. Portions of the National Wildlife Refuge downstream of Clarendon flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 27.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is currently cresting at 27.0 feet. It will then begin to gradually fall to a stage near 26.8 feet on Sunday. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date White River Clarendon 26.0 27.0 Fri 9 AM 26.9 26.8 26.6 27.0 **CRESTING** &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
